Articles.Content:
Juno is a spacecraft that was launched in 2011 And will orbit Jupiter this is my replica.

![V0U4dHx.png](http://i.imgur.com/V0U4dHx.png)

![8NKsJKD.png](http://i.imgur.com/8NKsJKD.png)

Download: [http://www./download/xpmirsk3g92id0e/Juno.craft](http://www./download/xpmirsk3g92id0e/Juno.craft)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-12T17:57:06Z" title="05/12/2015 05:57  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 12, 2015</time> by Lime**

[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juno_I](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juno_I)

that was confusing ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) but well done!

> 
> What's confusing?

I think he didn't know what Juno was.
Not the new Juno, I was go-ogling the old one at the time I found this ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

That is an awesome KSP version of the Juno Spacecraft. If you're interested in re-creating the Juno mission in KSP, I have a tutorial on how to do a fly-by of Kerbin to get a gravity assist to Jool. It can save 400 m/s and it's not as hard as doing fly-by gravity assist by other planets. The link to it is below.

[Juno style Kerbin fly-by to Jool](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/122780-Juno-style-Kerbin-fly-by-to-Jool)
The link provided is broken. Could you reup pls?
